FuncDef: The display nat instance dynamic-address-group command displays information about a dynamic address pool in a specified NAT instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of a dynamic address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies a HA backup group ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display nat instance cpe1 dynamic-address-group pool1 service-location 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about a dynamic address pool in a specified NAT instance, run the display nat instance dynamic-address-group command.
Precautions
If information about dynamic address allocation is queried on a running device, data of different service-locations may be inaccurate. To obtain accurate data, query the data again after a while.
